But, ah!  what mournful sounds are these invade,</br>With sighs of woe, the startl'd Muse's ear?</br>The sun-bright triumph of the day o'ershade?—</br>Heart-rending scene — Flow, flow unceasing tears!</br>Oh see where blooming MANNERS bleeding lies!</br>While Conquest plumes his crest, Death's slumbers seal his eyes.

Oh glorious Youth!  in thee with lustre shone,</br>Like Spring's fair morn, the honours of thy race;</br>In thy clear breast firm Valour fix'd his throne,</br>Temper'd with social Virtue's softer grace:</br>Pride of thy friends!  this heart-felt verse receive,</br>'Tis all the sorrowing Muse to worth like thine can give.

In vain gay Fortune pour'd her lavish tide,</br>And Pleasure warbl'd soul-dissolving airs</br>To  woo the Hero from Bellona's side;</br>While milder Fame her civic wreath prepares:</br>Unmov'd he view'd her amaranthine flow'rs,</br>And Fortune's golden throne, and Pleasure's roseate bow'rs.

Through groves that glow'd with vegetable gold,</br>Where nightingales soft trill'd their plaintive tales,</br>Pure sapphire rills in soothing murmurs roll'd,</br>And all Arabia breath'd in gentle gales;</br>Unmov'd by fair Armida's syren song,</br>Thus, fam'd Rinaldo pass'd to Glory's field along.

Nor shall your signal worth, ye gallant pair!</br>Die while a lyre of gratitude be strung:</br>Through distant times, the names of BAYNE and BLAIR,</br>Shall live with honour, and with pride be sung:</br>Their kindred Fate, calm Courage long shall mourn,</br>And nautic Science crown with sea-green gems their urn.

Lamented chiefs!  if aught your souls can move,</br>Beneath the star-pav'd mansions of the skies;</br>Behold the tribute of your country's love,</br>Among her sages, Kings, and warriors rise!</br>Where, o'er your breathing marble, sad she stands,</br>Weaving a triple wreath, with fond, maternal hands.

There, future Bards, the Moon's pensive light,</br>That through the bright-stain'd windows trembling shines,</br>Shall musing rove, and, with sublime delight,</br>Hear Angels, hov'ring o'er the hallow'd shrines</br>Their requiems sing, while slow and solemn join</br>The swelling organ's notes amid the choir divine.

Yet, while, departed Chiefs!  ye claim her tear,</br>Permit the Muse one tribute still to pay;</br>With filial rev'rence on a Parent's bier,</br>One laurel branch with cypress twin'd to lay:</br>Early, like you, he plough'd the stormy wave,</br>And hurl'd on Britain's foes the vengeance of the brave.

Their banner, thick with gilded lilies strown,</br>That flam'd with radiance like the martial star,</br>He won, to wave upon the British throne</br>'Midst countless trophies of triumphant war:</br>Nor ceas'd the veteran's toils, 'till o'er the head,</br>For ten long lustr's, Time, his hoary silver spread.

Thrice honour'd Shade! — Oh deign these rites to own;</br>No longer then the  drooping Muse shall mourn</br>Her Genius chill'd by adverse Fortune's frown,</br>Save that she wept not o'er thy recent urn.</br>Heard not thy parting blessing fervent rise,</br>Nor clos'd, with pious care, thy life-forsaken eyes. . . .</br>
